bill_title: modify the amount of time to report an injury for workers' compensation.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to modify the amount of time to report an injury for workers' compensation. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 62-7-10 be AMENDED: 62-7-10. An employee who claims compensation for an injury shall immediately, or as soon thereafter as practical, notify the employer of the occurrence of the injury. Written must provide written notice of the injury shall be provided to the employer no later than three fifteen business days after its occurrence. The notice need not be in any particular form but must advise the employer of when, where, and how the injury occurred. Failure to give notice as required by this section prohibits a claim for compensation under this title unless the employee or the employee's representative can show: (1) The employer or the employer's representative had actual knowledge of the injury; or (2) The employer was given written notice after the date of the injury and the employee had good cause for failing to give written notice within the three fifteen business‑day period., which The good cause determination shall must be liberally construed in favor of the employee.
